result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

03:07 PM Defendant Cory Donald Kiser in court by video in custody with attorney Shanna Knueppel by video.  David Zarwell and Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Cash bond of $1000 set with conditions of no possession of any weapons.  No contact directly or indirectly with victims D.W.L. or K.L.N., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No contact with Co Defendants Joshua Vega-Kelley, Anthony Kreyer or Angel Norman. No contact with the Driftwood Motel.  Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom.
